task.title: Specifying read-write for new buckets
task.shortdesc: The number of readers and writer are typically set when creating a data bucket: Data Buckets > Create New Data Bucket > Disk Read-Write Concurrency.

context.p: The number of readers and writers are typically specified (default: 3) when a new bucket is created. Although, the read-write setting can also be modified on existing buckets.
This default bucket is now ready to receive and serve requests. If named bucket is created, a similar status indicator displays next to the named bucket.

step.cmd: Under Data Buckets, click Create New Data Bucket.
step.info: A Configure Bucket panel appears where you can provide settings for the new bucket.

step.cmd: Under Disk I/O Optimization, specify the bucket disk I/O priority. Low (default) sets three (3) reader/writers and High allocates eight (8).
Provide other bucket-level settings of your choice.
